title: Can a teacher from a different school write my recommendation letter? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely if that teacher is knowledgeable about you. He should explain why he is writing (assuming it is not a supplementary letter). Parents and kids change schools or go to other schools because something is not available at their regular school. A child of mine had a recommendation from her swim coach. He knew her 2 years. Her previous coach passed away after 10 years…. The old coach was her year round coach and high school swim coach.

A2A. Who are your other recommenders? In the details, your teacher is only tutoring you. They can only view you academically which would show on your transcript, not as a character reference. It would be a weak recommendation. If you look at the selection criteria, recommenders are telling the university what you bring to the table if you were admitted. Saying that you had a tutor does not answer this question. To get an idea of what the university is looking for, see College essays, the last and most important step in an undergraduate application where I use MIT selection criteria as an example. Although this is about graduate admissions, I also recommend that you have your recommenders read Advice to Graduate School Recommendation Letter Writers that will show them how to write a letter of recommendation. Bottom line: When you ask someone to write a letter of recommendation, you should give them the selection criteria.

Yes, if you have taken courses from that teacher. However, No, if that person is a Paid Tutor. e.g. they teach at another school and you or your parents Hired that person to be your personal tutor. They are Not independent in that case.

Only if it’s not the only one. If he’s been tutoring you/reaching you privately, he knows you in a way your classroom teachers never will, but the reverse is also true. Colleges want to know how you will do in a college setting. Get a letter also from someone with whom you have done well at school and send both, if it is allowed.
The usual mandatory recommendations should come from two of your school teachers. This other teacher can send a supplemental recommendation letter (if the college accepts additional letters).
